ai-pli-tv-kd1:30.4.4_0: a meal for the Sangha, a meal for designated monks, an invitational meal, a meal for which lots are drawn, a half-monthly meal, a meal on the observance day, and a meal on the day after the observance day.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:30.4.5_0: One gone forth is supported by rag-robes. You should persevere with this for life.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:30.4.7_0: linen, cotton, silk, wool, sunn hemp, and hemp.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:30.4.8_0: One gone forth is supported by the foot of a tree as resting place. You should persevere with this for life.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:30.4.10_0: a dwelling, a stilt house, and a cave.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:30.4.11_0: One gone forth is supported by medicine of fermented urine. You should persevere with this for life.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:30.4.13_0: ghee, butter, oil, honey, and syrup.”
ai-pli-tv-kd1:30.4.14_0: The fifth section for recitation on the proper conduct toward the preceptor is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:31.1.1_0: Soon afterwards a young brahmin approached the monks and asked for the going forth.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:31.1.2_0: The monks told him about the four supports.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:31.1.4_0: “Venerables, if you had told me about this after my going forth, I would have been fine.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:31.1.5_0: But now I won’t go forth,
ai-pli-tv-kd1:31.1.6_0: for these supports are disgusting and repulsive to me.”
ai-pli-tv-kd1:31.1.8_0: “You should not point out the four supports beforehand.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:31.1.9_0: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:31.1.10_0: You should point out the supports immediately after the full ordination.”
ai-pli-tv-kd1:31.2.1_0: At that time the monks gave the full ordination in groups of two and three.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:31.2.3_0: “You should not give the full ordination in groups of less than ten.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:31.2.4_0: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:31.2.5_0: You should give the full ordination in groups of ten or more than ten.”
ai-pli-tv-kd1:31.3.1_0: At that time monks who only had one or two years of seniority gave the full ordination,
ai-pli-tv-kd1:31.3.2_0: one of whom was Venerable Upasena of Vaṅganta.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:31.3.3_0: When he had completed the rainy-season residence, he went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down,
ai-pli-tv-kd1:31.3.4_0: Since it is the custom for Buddhas to greet newly arrived monks,
ai-pli-tv-kd1:31.4.2_0: “I hope you are keeping well, monk, I hope you’re comfortable;
ai-pli-tv-kd1:31.4.3_0: I hope you’re not tired from traveling.”
ai-pli-tv-kd1:31.4.4_0: “I can bear up, Fortunate One, I can carry on, Fortunate One,
ai-pli-tv-kd1:31.4.5_0: and I’m not tired from traveling.”
ai-pli-tv-kd1:31.4.6_0: When Buddhas know what is going on, sometimes they ask and sometimes not; they know the right time to ask and the right time not to ask.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:31.4.7_0: Buddhas ask when it is beneficial, not when it is unbeneficial,
ai-pli-tv-kd1:31.4.8_0: by the Realized Ones are incapable of doing what is unbeneficial.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:31.4.9_0: Buddhas question the monks for two reasons: to give a teaching or to lay down a training rule.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:31.5.1_0: The Buddha said to Upasena, “How long have you been a monk?”
ai-pli-tv-kd1:31.5.8_0: “It’s not suitable, foolish man, it’s not proper, it’s not worthy of an ascetic, it’s not allowable, it’s not to be done.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:31.5.9_0: How can you, who should be taught and instructed by others, think to teach and instruct another?
ai-pli-tv-kd1:31.5.10_0: You have turned to abundance too readily, that is, by forming a group.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:31.5.11_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...
ai-pli-tv-kd1:31.5.13_0: he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd1:31.5.14_0: “You should not give the full ordination if you have less than ten years of seniority.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:31.5.15_0: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:31.5.16_0: You should give the full ordination in ten or more years of seniority.”
ai-pli-tv-kd1:31.6.1_0: Knowing that the Buddha had made this allowance,
ai-pli-tv-kd1:31.6.2_0: when they had ten years of seniority,
ai-pli-tv-kd1:31.6.3_0: ignorant and incompetent monks gave the full ordination.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:31.6.4_0: As a result there were ignorant preceptors with knowledgeable students,
ai-pli-tv-kd1:31.6.8_0: A monk who was formerly an ascetic of another religion refuted his preceptor, even though he had been legitimately corrected by him. He then returned to that religious community.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:31.7.1_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Udāyī,
ai-pli-tv-kd1:31.7.2_0: “How can ignorant and incompetent monks give the full ordination just because they have ten years of seniority?
ai-pli-tv-kd1:31.7.5_0: “Is it true, monks, that this is happening?”
ai-pli-tv-kd1:31.7.6_0: when they had ten years of seniority,
ai-pli-tv-kd1:31.7.7_0: ignorant and incompetent monks gave the full ordination.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:31.8.2_0: “How can those foolish men give the full ordination just because they have ten years of seniority?
ai-pli-tv-kd1:31.8.4_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”
ai-pli-tv-kd1:31.8.6_0: he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd1:31.8.7_0: “An ignorant and incompetent monk should not give the full ordination.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:31.8.8_0: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:31.8.9_0: I allow a competent and capable monk to give the full ordination, if he has ten or more years of seniority.”
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.1.1_0: At that time there were preceptors who left, disrobed, died, or joined another faction, and as a consequence their students were not being instructed.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.1.2_0: While walking for almsfood, they were shabbily dressed and improper in appearance.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.1.3_0: While people were eating, they held out their almsbowls to receive leftovers, even right over their food, whether it was staple food, non-staple food, delicacies, or drinks.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.1.4_0: They ate bean curry and rice that they themselves had asked for,
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.1.5_0: and they were noisy in the dining hall.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.1.6_0: People complained and criticized the monks,
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.1.7_0: “How can the Sakyan ascetics act like this?
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.1.8_0: While people were eating, they brought out the almsbowls to receive leftovers, even right over their food, whether it was staple food, non-staple food, or drinks.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.1.9_0: They eat rice and bean curry that they themselves have asked for,
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.1.10_0: And even the brahmins will live in the dining hall like food.”
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.1.11_0: The monks heard the complaints of those people. ...
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.1.14_0: “It’s true, Sir.” ... and the Buddha addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.1.15_0: after criticizing them, he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.1.17_0: The teacher should regard his pupil as a son and the teacher’s pupil.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.1.18_0: In this way they will respect, esteem, and be considerate toward each other, and they will grow and reach greatness on this spiritual path.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.1.19_0: You should live with formal support for ten years. And I allow a monk of ten years’ seniority to give such support.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.2.1_0: And a teacher should be chosen like this:
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.2.2_0: After putting his upper robe over one shoulder, a student should pay respect at the feet of a potential preceptor. He should then squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say,
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.2.4_0: And he should repeat this a second
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.2.6_0: If the other makes it understood by body, by speech, or by body and speech: ‘Yes,’ or, ‘No problem,’ or, ‘It’s suitable,’ or, ‘It’s appropriate,’ or, ‘Carry on with inspiration’—then a teacher has been chosen.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.2.7_0: If the other doesn’t make it understood by body, by speech, or by body and speech, then a teacher hasn’t been chosen.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.1_0: A pupil should conduct himself properly toward his teacher.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.3_0: After getting up at the appropriate time, the pupil should take off his sandals, and put his upper robe over one shoulder. He should then give his teacher a toothbrush and water for rinsing the mouth, and he should prepare a seat for him.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.4_0: If there is rice porridge, he should wash a vessel and bring the rice porridge to his preceptor.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.5_0: When the preceptor has drunk the rice porridge, the student should give him water and receive the vessel, and holding it low, he should wash it carefully without scratching it and then put it away.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.6_0: When the teacher has gotten up, the pupil should put away the seat.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.7_0: If the place is dirty, he should sweep it.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.8_0: If the teacher wants to enter the village, the pupil should give him a sarong and receive the one he’s wearing in return. He should give him a belt. He should put the upper robes together, overlapping each other edge-to-edge, and then give them to him. He should wash his teacher’s bowl and then give it to him while wet.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.9_0: If the teacher wants an attendant, the pupil should put on his sarong evenly all around, covering the navel and the knees. He should put on a belt. Putting the upper robes together, overlapping each other edge-to-edge, he should put them on and fasten the toggle. After washing his bowl, he should take it with him and be his teacher’s attendant.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.10_0: He shouldn’t walk too far behind his preceptor or too close to him. He should receive the contents of his bowl.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.11_0: He shouldn’t interrupt his teacher when he’s speaking.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.12_0: But if the teacher’s speech is bordering on an offense, he should stop him.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.13_0: When returning, the pupil should go first to prepare a seat and to set out a foot-stool, a foot-scraper, and water for washing the feet. He should go out to meet the teacher to receive his bowl and robe. He should give him a sarong and receive the one he’s wearing in return.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.14_0: If the robe is moist, he should sun it for a short while, but he shouldn’t leave it in the heat.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.16_0: offsetting the edges by seven centimeters,
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.17_0: so that the fold doesn’t become worn.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.18_0: He should place the belt in the fold.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.19_0: If there is almsfood and his teacher wants to eat, the pupil should give him water and then the almsfood.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.20_0: He should ask his teacher if he wants water to drink.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.21_0: When the preceptor has eaten, the student should give him water and receive the bowl, and holding it low, he should wash it carefully without scratching it. He should then dry it and sun it for a short while, but he shouldn’t leave it in the heat.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.22_0: He should put away the bowl and robe.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.23_0: When putting away the bowl, he should hold the bowl in one hand, feel under the bed or the bench with the other, and then put it away.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.24_0: he should not put his bowl on the ground evenly on the ground.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.25_0: After taking hold of the robe-cloth with one hand and then puts it on the edge of the robe within arm’s reach of the other, he should put it on and put it aside.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.26_0: When the teacher has gotten up, the pupil should put away the seat and also the foot-stool, the foot-scraper, and the water for washing the feet.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.27_0: If the place is dirty, he should sweep it.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.28_0: “If the teacher wants to bathe, the pupil should prepare the bath.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.29_0: If he needs cold, he should prepare cold.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.30_0: if he wants a hot bath, he should prepare that.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.31_0: If the teacher wants to use the sauna, the pupil should knead bath powder, moisten the clay, take the sauna stool, and follow behind his teacher. After giving the teacher the sauna stool, receiving his robe, and putting it aside, he should give him the bath powder and the clay.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.32_0: If he’s able, he should enter the sauna.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.33_0: When entering the sauna, he should smear his face with clay, cover himself in front and behind, and then enter the sauna.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.34_0: He shouldn’t sit encroaching on the senior monks,
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.35_0: and he shouldn’t block the junior monks from getting a seat.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.36_0: While in the sauna, he should do services for his teacher.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.37_0: When leaving the sauna, he should take the sauna stool, cover himself in front and behind, and then leave the sauna.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.38_0: He should also do services for his teacher in the water.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.39_0: When he has bathed, he should be the first to come out of the water. He should dry himself and put on his sarong. He should then wipe the water off his teacher’s body, and he should give him his sarong and then his upper robe. Taking the sauna stool, he should be the first to return. He should prepare a seat, as well as set out a foot-stool, a foot-scraper, and water for washing the feet.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.40_0: He should ask his teacher if he wants water to drink.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.41_0: If the preceptor wants him to recite, he should do so.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.42_0: If the preceptor wants to question him, he should be questioned.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.43_0: “If the dwelling where the teacher is staying is dirty, the pupil should clean it if he’s able.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.44_0: When he is cleaning the dwelling, he should first take out the bowl and robe and put them aside.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.45_0: He should take out the sitting mat and the sheet and put them aside.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.46_0: He should take out the mattress and the pillow and put them aside.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.47_0: Holding the bed low, he should carefully take it out without scratching it or knocking it against the door or the door frame, and he should put it aside.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.48_0: Holding the bench low, he should carefully take it out without scratching it or knocking it against the door or the door frame, and he should put it aside.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.49_0: He should take out the bed supports and put them aside.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.50_0: He should take out the spit and put it aside.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.51_0: He should take out the leaning board and put it aside.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.52_0: After taking note of where it’s placed, he should take out the floor cover and put it aside.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.53_0: If the dwelling has cobwebs, he should first remove them from the ceiling cloth, and he should then wipe the windows and the corners of the room.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.54_0: If the walls have been treated with red ocher and they’re moldy, he should moisten a cloth, wring it out, and wipe the walls.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.55_0: If the floor has been treated with black and it’s moldy, he should moisten a cloth, wring it out, and wipe the floor.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.56_0: If the floor is untreated, he should sprinkle it with water and then sweep it,
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.57_0: while trying to avoid stirring up dust.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.58_0: He should look out for any trash and discard it.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.59_0: He should sun the floor cover, clean it, beat it, bring it back inside, and put it back in the same place as before.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.60_0: He should sun the bed supports, wipe them, bring them back inside, and place them in the same position as before.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.61_0: He should sun the bed, clean it, and beat it. Holding it low, he should carefully bring it back inside without scratching it or knocking it against the door or the door frame, and he should put it back in the same place as before.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.62_0: He should sun the bench, clean it, and beat it. Holding it low, he should carefully bring it back inside without scratching it or knocking it against the door or the door frame, and he should put it back in the same place as before.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.63_0: He should sun the mattress and the pillow, clean them, beat them, bring them back inside, and put them back the way they were.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.64_0: He should sun the sitting mat and the sheet, clean them, beat them, bring them back inside, and put them back the way they were.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.65_0: He should sun the spittoon, wipe it, bring it back inside, and put it back where it was.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.66_0: He should sun the leaning board, wipe it, bring it back inside, and put it back where it was.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.67_0: He should put away the bowl and robe.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.68_0: When putting away the bowl, he should hold the bowl in one hand, feel under the bed or the bench with the other, and then put it away.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.69_0: he should not put his bowl on the ground evenly on the ground.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.70_0: After taking hold of the robe-cloth with one hand and then puts it on the edge of the robe within arm’s reach of the other, he should put it on and put it aside.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.71_0: If dusty winds are blowing from the east, he should close the windows on the eastern side.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.72_0: If dusty winds are blowing from the west, he should close the windows on the west.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.73_0: If dusty winds are blowing from the north, he should close the windows on the northern side.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.74_0: If dusty winds are blowing from the south, he should close the windows on the southern side.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.75_0: If the weather is cold, he should open the windows during the day and close them at night.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.76_0: If the weather is hot, he should close the windows during the day and open them at night.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.77_0: If the precincts are dirty, he should sweep them.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.78_0: If the gateway is dirty, he should sweep it.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.79_0: If the assembly hall is dirty, he should sweep it.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.80_0: If the water-boiling shed is dirty, he should sweep it.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.81_0: If the restroom is dirty, he should sweep it.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.82_0: If there is no water for drinking, he should set it out.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.83_0: If there is no water for washing, he should set it out.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.84_0: If there is no water in the pot for rinsing water, he should fill it.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.85_0: “If the teacher becomes discontent, the pupil should send him away or have him sent away, or he should give him a teaching.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.86_0: If the teacher becomes anxious, the pupil should dispel it or have it dispelled, or he should give him a teaching.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.87_0: If the teacher has a wrong view, the pupil should make him give it up or get someone else to do it, or he should give him a teaching.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.88_0: If the teacher has committed a heavy offense and deserves probation,
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.89_0: the pupil should try for the Sangha to get it done.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.90_0: If the teacher has committed a heavy offense and deserves to be sent back to the beginning,
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.91_0: the pupil should try for the Sangha to get it done.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.92_0: If the teacher has committed a heavy offense and deserves to be given the trial period,
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.93_0: the pupil should try for the Sangha to get it done.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.94_0: If the teacher has committed a heavy offense and deserves rehabilitation,
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.95_0: the pupil should try for the Sangha to get it done.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.96_0: If the Sangha wants to do a legal procedure against his teacher—whether a procedure of condemnation, demotion, banishment, reconciliation, or ejection—
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.97_0: the pupil should make an effort to stop it or to reduce the penalty.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.98_0: But if the Sangha has already done a legal procedure against his teacher—whether a procedure of condemnation, demotion, banishment, reconciliation, or ejection—
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.99_0: the pupil should help the teacher conduct himself properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released, and try for the Sangha to lift that procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.100_0: “If the teacher’s robe needs washing, the pupil should do it himself,
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.101_0: or he should make an effort to have it done.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.102_0: If the teacher needs a robe, the pupil should make one himself,
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.103_0: or he should make an effort to have one made.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.104_0: If the teacher needs dye, the pupil should make it himself,
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.105_0: or he should make an effort to have it made.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.106_0: If the teacher’s robe needs dyeing, the pupil should do it himself,
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.107_0: or he should make an effort to have it done.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.108_0: When he’s dyeing the robe, he should carefully and repeatedly turn it over, and he shouldn’t go away while it’s still dripping.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.109_0: Without asking permission of his teacher, he shouldn’t do any of the following: give away or receive a bowl;
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.112_0: give away or have a requisite;
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.114_0: cut anyone’s hair or have it cut;
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.117_0: or have work done by anyone;
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.120_0: be the attendant monk for anyone
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.121_0: or take anyone as his attendant monk;
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.123_0: or have almsfood brought back by anyone;
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.124_0: enter the village, go to the charnel ground, or leave for another region.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.125_0: If his teacher is sick, he should nurse him for as long as he lives, or he should wait until he has recovered.”
ai-pli-tv-kd1:32.3.126_0: The proper conduct toward a teacher is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.1_0: “A pupil should conduct himself properly toward his pupil.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.3_0: A teacher should help and take care of his pupil through recitation, questioning, and instruction.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.4_0: If the teacher has a bowl, but not the pupil, the teacher should give it to him,
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.5_0: or he should make an effort to get him one.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.6_0: If the teacher has a robe, but not the pupil, the teacher should give it to him,
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.7_0: or he should make an effort to get him one.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.8_0: If the teacher has a requisite, but not the pupil, the teacher should give it to him,
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.9_0: or he should make an effort to get him one.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.10_0: If the pupil is sick, the teacher should get up at the appropriate time, and he should give his pupil a toothbrush and water for rinsing the mouth, and he should prepare a seat for him.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.11_0: If there is rice porridge, he should wash a vessel and bring the rice porridge to his preceptor.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.12_0: When the preceptor has drunk the rice porridge, the student should give him water and receive the vessel, and holding it low, he should wash it carefully without scratching it and then put it away.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.13_0: When the pupil has gotten up, the teacher should put away the seat.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.14_0: If the place is dirty, he should sweep it.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.15_0: If the pupil wants to enter the village, the teacher should give him a sarong and receive the one he’s wearing in return. He should give him a belt. He should put the upper robes together, overlapping each other edge-to-edge, and then give them to him. He should wash his pupil’s bowl and then give it to him while wet.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.16_0: Before he’s due back, the teacher should prepare a seat and set out a foot-stool, a foot-scraper, and water for washing the feet. He should go out to meet the pupil to receive his bowl and robe. He should give him a sarong and receive the one he’s wearing in return.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.17_0: If the robe is moist, he should sun it for a short while, but he shouldn’t leave it in the heat.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.19_0: offsetting the edges by seven centimeters,
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.20_0: so that the fold doesn’t become worn.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.21_0: He should place the belt in the fold.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.22_0: If there is almsfood and his pupil wants to eat, the teacher should give him water and then the almsfood.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.23_0: He should ask his pupil if he wants water to drink.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.24_0: When the preceptor has eaten, the student should give him water and receive the bowl, and holding it low, he should wash it carefully without scratching it. He should then dry it and sun it for a short while, but he shouldn’t leave it in the heat.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.25_0: He should put away the bowl and robe.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.26_0: When putting away the bowl, he should hold the bowl in one hand, feel under the bed or the bench with the other, and then put it away.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.27_0: he should not put his bowl on the ground evenly on the ground.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.28_0: After taking hold of the robe-cloth with one hand and then puts it on the edge of the robe within arm’s reach of the other, he should put it on and put it aside.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.29_0: When the pupil has gotten up, the teacher should put away the seat and also the foot-stool, the foot-scraper, and the water for washing the feet.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.30_0: If the place is dirty, he should sweep it.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.31_0: “If the pupil wants to bathe, the teacher should prepare the bath.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.32_0: If he needs cold, he should prepare cold.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.33_0: if he wants a hot bath, he should prepare that.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.34_0: If the pupil wants to use the sauna, the teacher should knead bath powder, moisten the clay, take the sauna stool, and go to the sauna. After giving the pupil the sauna stool, receiving his robe, and putting it aside, he should give him the bath powder and the clay.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.35_0: If he’s able, he should enter the sauna.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.36_0: When entering the sauna, he should smear his face with clay, cover himself in front and behind, and then enter the sauna.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.37_0: He shouldn’t sit encroaching on the senior monks, and he shouldn’t block the junior monks from getting a seat.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.38_0: While in the sauna, he should do services for his pupil.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.39_0: When leaving the sauna, he should take the sauna stool, cover himself in front and behind, and then leave the sauna.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.40_0: The teacher should also do services for his pupil in the water.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.41_0: When the teacher has bathed, he should be the first to come out of the water. He should dry himself and put on his sarong. He should then wipe the water off his pupil’s body, and he should give him his sarong and then his upper robe. Taking the sauna stool, he should be the first to return. He should prepare a seat, as well as set out a foot-stool, a foot-scraper, and water for washing the feet.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.42_0: He should ask his pupil if he wants water to drink.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.43_0: “If the dwelling where the pupil is staying is dirty, the teacher should clean it if he’s able.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.44_0: When he is cleaning the dwelling, he should first take out the bowl and robe and put them aside.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.45_0: He should take out the sitting mat and the sheet and put them aside.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.46_0: He should take out the mattress and the pillow and put them aside.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.47_0: Holding the bed low, he should carefully take it out without scratching it or knocking it against the door or the door frame, and he should put it aside.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.48_0: Holding the bench low, he should carefully take it out without scratching it or knocking it against the door or the door frame, and he should put it aside.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.49_0: He should take out the bed supports and put them aside.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.50_0: He should take out the spit and put it aside.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.51_0: He should take out the leaning board and put it aside.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.52_0: After taking note of where it’s placed, he should take out the floor cover and put it aside.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.53_0: If the dwelling has cobwebs, he should first remove them from the ceiling cloth, and he should then wipe the windows and the corners of the room.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.54_0: If the walls have been treated with red ocher and they’re moldy, he should moisten a cloth, wring it out, and wipe the walls.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.55_0: If the floor has been treated with black and it’s moldy, he should moisten a cloth, wring it out, and wipe the floor.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.56_0: If the floor is untreated, he should sprinkle it with water and then sweep it,
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.57_0: while trying to avoid stirring up dust.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.58_0: He should look out for any trash and discard it.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.59_0: He should sun the floor cover, clean it, beat it, bring it back inside, and put it back in the same place as before.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.60_0: He should sun the bed supports, wipe them, bring them back inside, and place them in the same position as before.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.61_0: He should sun the bed, clean it, and beat it. Holding it low, he should carefully bring it back inside without scratching it or knocking it against the door or the door frame, and he should put it back in the same place as before.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.62_0: He should sun the bench, clean it, and beat it. Holding it low, he should carefully bring it back inside without scratching it or knocking it against the door or the door frame, and he should put it back in the same place as before.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.63_0: He should sun the mattress and the pillow, clean them, beat them, bring them back inside, and put them back the way they were.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.64_0: He should sun the sitting mat and the sheet, clean them, beat them, bring them back inside, and put them back the way they were.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.65_0: He should sun the spittoon, wipe it, bring it back inside, and put it back where it was.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.66_0: He should sun the leaning board, wipe it, bring it back inside, and put it back where it was.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.67_0: He should put away the bowl and robe.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.68_0: When putting away the bowl, he should hold the bowl in one hand, feel under the bed or the bench with the other, and then put it away.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.69_0: he should not put his bowl on the ground evenly on the ground.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.70_0: After taking hold of the robe-cloth with one hand and then puts it on the edge of the robe within arm’s reach of the other, he should put it on and put it aside.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.71_0: If dusty winds are blowing from the east, he should close the windows on the eastern side.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.72_0: If dusty winds are blowing from the west, he should close the windows on the west.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.73_0: If dusty winds are blowing from the north, he should close the windows on the northern side.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.74_0: If dusty winds are blowing from the south, he should close the windows on the southern side.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.75_0: If the weather is cold, he should open the windows during the day and close them at night.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.76_0: If the weather is hot, he should close the windows during the day and open them at night.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.77_0: If the precincts are dirty, he should sweep them.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.78_0: If the gateway is dirty, he should sweep it.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.79_0: If the assembly hall is dirty, he should sweep it.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.80_0: If the water-boiling shed is dirty, he should sweep it.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.81_0: If the restroom is dirty, he should sweep it.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.82_0: If there is no water for drinking, he should set it out.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.83_0: If there is no water for washing, he should set it out.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.84_0: If there is no water in the rinsing pot, he should fill it.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.85_0: “If the pupil becomes discontent, the teacher should send him away or have him sent away, or he should give him a teaching.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.86_0: If the pupil becomes anxious, the teacher should dispel it or have it dispelled, or he should give him a teaching.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.87_0: If the pupil has a wrong view, the teacher should make him give it up or get someone else to do it, or he should give him a teaching.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.88_0: If the pupil has committed a heavy offense and deserves probation,
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.89_0: the teacher should try for the Sangha to get it done.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.90_0: If the pupil has committed a heavy offense and deserves to be sent back to the beginning,
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.91_0: the teacher should try for the Sangha to get it done.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.92_0: If the pupil has committed a heavy offense and deserves to be given the trial period,
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.93_0: the teacher should try for the Sangha to get it done.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.94_0: If the pupil has committed a heavy offense and deserves rehabilitation,
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.95_0: the teacher should try for the Sangha to get it done.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.96_0: If the Sangha wants to do a legal procedure against his pupil—whether a procedure of condemnation, demotion, banishment, reconciliation, or ejection—
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.97_0: the teacher should make an effort to stop it or to reduce the penalty.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.98_0: But if the Sangha has already done a legal procedure against his pupil—whether a procedure of condemnation, demotion, banishment, reconciliation, or ejection—
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.99_0: the teacher should help the pupil conduct himself properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released, and try for the Sangha to lift that procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.100_0: “If the pupil’s robe needs washing, the teacher should show him how to do it,
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.101_0: or he should make an effort to have it done.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.102_0: If the pupil needs a robe, the teacher should show him how to make one,
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.103_0: or he should make an effort to have one made.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.104_0: If the pupil needs dye, the teacher should show him how to make it,
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.105_0: or he should make an effort to have it made.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.106_0: If the pupil’s robe needs dyeing, the teacher should show him how to do it,
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.107_0: or he should make an effort to have it done.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.108_0: When he’s dyeing the robe, he should carefully and repeatedly turn it over, and he shouldn’t go away while it’s still dripping.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.109_0: If his pupil is sick, he should nurse him for as long as he lives, or he should wait until he has recovered.”
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.110_0: The proper conduct toward a pupil is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:33.1.111_0: The sixth section for recitation is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:34.1.1_0: On a later occasion the pupils did not conduct themselves properly toward their teachers. ...
ai-pli-tv-kd1:34.1.2_0: They told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned Devadatta:
ai-pli-tv-kd1:34.1.3_0: “A pupil should conduct himself properly toward his teacher.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:34.1.4_0: If he doesn’t, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.”
ai-pli-tv-kd1:34.1.5_0: They still did not conduct themselves properly.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:34.1.6_0: They told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned Devadatta:
ai-pli-tv-kd1:34.1.7_0: “You should dismiss one who doesn’t conduct himself properly.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:34.1.8_0: And this is how he should be dismissed.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:34.1.9_0: If the teacher makes it understood by body, by speech, or by body and speech: ʻI dismiss you,’ or, ʻDon’t come back here,’ or, ʻRemove your bowl and robe,’ or, ʻYou shouldn’t attend on me’—
ai-pli-tv-kd1:34.1.11_0: If he doesn’t make it understood by body, by speech, or by body and speech, then the pupil isn’t dismissed.”
ai-pli-tv-kd1:34.1.12_0: Pupils who had been dismissed did not ask for forgiveness.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:34.1.15_0: They still did not ask for forgiveness.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:34.1.18_0: If he doesn’t, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.”
ai-pli-tv-kd1:34.1.19_0: Teachers who were asked for forgiveness did not forgive.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:34.1.22_0: They still did not ask for forgiveness.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:34.1.23_0: The pupils left, disrobed, and joined the ascetics of other religions.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:34.1.25_0: “When asked for forgiveness, you should forgive.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:34.1.26_0: If you don’t, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”
ai-pli-tv-kd1:34.1.27_0: Teachers dismissed pupils who were conducting themselves properly and did not dismiss those who were not.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:34.1.30_0: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:34.1.31_0: And you should dismiss someone who isn’t conducting himself properly.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:34.1.32_0: If you don’t, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:34.1.33_0: “If a pupil has five qualities, he should be dismissed.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:34.1.34_0: He doesn’t have much affection for his teacher; he doesn’t have much confidence in his teacher; he doesn’t have a strong sense of conscience in regard to his teacher; he doesn’t have much respect for his teacher; he hasn’t developed his mind much under his teacher.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:34.1.35_0: You should be dismissed by a pupil.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:34.1.36_0: If a pupil has five qualities, he shouldn’t be dismissed.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:34.1.37_0: He has much affection for his teacher; he has much confidence in his teacher; he has a strong sense of conscience in regard to his teacher; he has much respect for his teacher; he has developed his mind much under his teacher.”
ai-pli-tv-kd1:34.1.38_0: If a pupil has these five qualities, he shouldn’t be dismissed.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:34.1.39_0: If a pupil has five qualities, he deserves to be dismissed.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:34.1.40_0: He doesn’t have much affection for his teacher; he doesn’t have much confidence in his teacher; he doesn’t have a strong sense of conscience in regard to his teacher; he doesn’t have much respect for his teacher; he hasn’t developed his mind much under his teacher.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:34.1.41_0: If a pupil has these five qualities, he deserves to be dismissed.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:34.1.42_0: If a pupil has five qualities, he doesn’t deserve to be dismissed.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:34.1.43_0: He has much affection for his teacher; he has much confidence in his teacher; he has a strong sense of conscience in regard to his teacher; he has much respect for his teacher; he has developed his mind much under his teacher.”
ai-pli-tv-kd1:34.1.44_0: If a pupil has these five qualities, he doesn’t deserve to be dismissed.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:34.1.45_0: If a pupil has five qualities, the teacher is at fault if he doesn’t dismiss him, but he’s not at fault if he dismisses him.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:34.1.46_0: He doesn’t have much affection for his teacher; he doesn’t have much confidence in his teacher; he doesn’t have a strong sense of conscience in regard to his teacher; he doesn’t have much respect for his teacher; he hasn’t developed his mind much under his teacher.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:34.1.47_0: If a pupil has these five qualities, the teacher is at fault if he doesn’t dismiss him, but he’s not at fault if he dismisses him.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:34.1.48_0: If a pupil has five qualities, the teacher is at fault if he dismisses him, but he’s not at fault if he doesn’t dismiss him.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:34.1.49_0: He has much affection for his teacher; he has much confidence in his teacher; he has a strong sense of conscience in regard to his teacher; he has much respect for his teacher; he has developed his mind much under his teacher.”
ai-pli-tv-kd1:34.1.50_0: If a pupil has these five qualities, the teacher is at fault if he dismisses him, but he’s not at fault if he doesn’t dismiss him.”
ai-pli-tv-kd1:34.1.51_0: Asking for forgiveness when dismissed is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:35.1.1_0: At that time ignorant and incompetent monks gave ten years to those who were ignorant.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:35.1.2_0: As a result there were ignorant teachers with knowledgeable pupils,
ai-pli-tv-kd1:35.1.6_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Udāyī,
ai-pli-tv-kd1:35.1.7_0: “How can ignorant and incompetent monks give formal support, just because they have ten years of seniority?
ai-pli-tv-kd1:35.1.8_0: There are ignorant teachers with knowledgeable pupils, incompetent teachers with competent pupils, uneducated teachers with learned pupils, stupid teachers with clever pupils.”
ai-pli-tv-kd1:35.2.1_0: They then told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned them:
ai-pli-tv-kd1:35.2.2_0: “Is it true, monks, that this is happening?”
ai-pli-tv-kd1:35.2.3_0: when they had ten years of seniority,
ai-pli-tv-kd1:35.2.8_0: he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd1:35.2.9_0: “An ignorant and incompetent monk should not give formal support.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:35.2.10_0: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:35.2.11_0: I allow a competent and capable monk to give formal support, if he has ten or more years of seniority.”
ai-pli-tv-kd1:35.2.12_0: The section on the ignorant and incompetent is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:36.1.0_0: Discussion of the ending of formal support
ai-pli-tv-kd1:36.1.1_0: At that time there were preceptors and teachers who went away, disrobed, died, or joined another faction, but their pupils did not know about the ending of support.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:36.1.3_0: “There are these five reasons why the formal support from a preceptor comes to an end:
ai-pli-tv-kd1:36.1.4_0: the preceptor goes away; the student disrobes; the preceptor dies; the grandmother faction; the teacher gives an order; or one is just one.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:36.1.5_0: These are the five reasons why the formal support from a preceptor is tranquilized.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:36.1.6_0: There are these six reasons why the formal support from a teacher comes to an end:
ai-pli-tv-kd1:36.1.7_0: the teacher goes away; the teacher disrobes; the teacher dies; the teacher joins another faction; the teacher gives an order; or one is reunited with one’s preceptor.”
ai-pli-tv-kd1:36.1.8_0: These are the six reasons why the formal support from a teacher comes to an end.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:36.1.9_0: The discussion of the ending of formal support is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:36.2.1_0: “A monk who has five qualities shouldn’t give the full ordination, give formal support, or have a novice monk attend on him.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:36.2.2_0: He doesn’t have the virtue, stillness, wisdom, freedom, or knowledge and vision of freedom of one fully trained.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:36.2.3_0: A monk who has these five qualities shouldn’t give the full ordination, give formal support, or have a novice monk attend on him.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:36.3.1_0: A monk who has five qualities may give the full ordination, give formal support, and have a novice monk attend on him.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:36.3.2_0: He has the virtue, stillness, wisdom, freedom, and knowledge and vision of freedom of one fully trained.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:36.3.3_0: A monk who has these five qualities may give the full ordination, give formal support, and have a novice monk attend on him.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:36.4.1_0: “A monk who has another five qualities shouldn’t give the full ordination, give formal support, or have a novice monk attend on him.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:36.4.2_0: He neither has nor encourages others in the virtue,
ai-pli-tv-kd1:36.4.6_0: or knowledge and vision of freedom of one fully trained.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:36.4.7_0: A monk who has these five qualities shouldn’t give the full ordination, give formal support, or have a novice monk attend on him.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:36.5.1_0: A monk who has five qualities may give the full ordination, give formal support, and have a novice monk attend on him.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:36.5.2_0: He both has and encourages others in the virtue,
ai-pli-tv-kd1:36.5.5_0: and freedom of one fully trained,
ai-pli-tv-kd1:36.5.6_0: and knowledge and vision of freedom of one fully trained.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:36.5.7_0: A monk who has these five qualities may give the full ordination, give formal support, and have a novice monk attend on him.

ai-pli-tv-kd1:38.1.1_0: Soon afterwards he who was formerly an ascetic of another religion and who had returned to that religious community after refuting his preceptor
ai-pli-tv-kd1:38.1.2_0: came back to the monks and asked for the full ordination.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:38.1.3_0: They in turn told the Buddha.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:38.1.4_0: “Monks, when someone who was formerly an ascetic of another religion refutes his preceptor after being legitimately corrected by him and then returns to that religion, but then comes back from that religious community once more, he should not be given the full ordination.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:38.1.5_0: Anyone else who was formerly an ascetic of another religion who wants the going forth and the full ordination on this spiritual path should be given four months of probation.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:38.2.1_0: And it should be given like this:
ai-pli-tv-kd1:38.2.2_0: First the candidate should shave off his hair and beard and put on ocher robes. He should then put his upper robe over one shoulder, pay respect at the feet of the monks, squat on his heels, and raise his joined palms. He should then be told to say this:
ai-pli-tv-kd1:38.2.3_0: ʻI take refuge in the Buddha,
ai-pli-tv-kd1:38.2.4_0: I go to the Dhamma for refuge
ai-pli-tv-kd1:38.2.5_0: I go to the Saṅgha for refuge
ai-pli-tv-kd1:38.2.6_0: For a second time I go to the Buddha for refuge
ai-pli-tv-kd1:38.2.7_0: for the second time I take refuge in the Teaching,
ai-pli-tv-kd1:38.2.8_0: for the second time I take refuge in the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:38.2.9_0: For a third time I go to the Buddha for refuge
ai-pli-tv-kd1:38.2.10_0: for the third time I take refuge in the Teaching,
ai-pli-tv-kd1:38.2.11_0: For the third time I take refuge in the Sangha.’”
ai-pli-tv-kd1:38.3.1_0: After approaching the Sangha of nuns, the monk who was formerly an ascetic of another religion should put his upper robe over one shoulder, pay respect at the feet of the monks, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say:
ai-pli-tv-kd1:38.3.2_0: ‘Sir, I wish on probation in this teaching and training.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:38.3.3_0: I ask the Sangha for four months of probation.’
ai-pli-tv-kd1:38.3.4_0: And he should ask a second
ai-pli-tv-kd1:38.3.6_0: A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:
ai-pli-tv-kd1:38.3.7_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:38.3.8_0: So-and-so formerly an ascetic of another religion who wants the full ordination in this teaching and training.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:38.3.9_0: He is asking the Sangha for four months of probation.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:38.3.10_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should give so-and-so four months of probation.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:38.4.1_0: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:38.4.2_0: So-and-so formerly an ascetic of another religion who wants the full ordination in this teaching and training.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:38.4.3_0: He is asking the Sangha for four months of probation.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:38.4.4_0: The Sangha gives him that probation.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:38.4.5_0: Any monk who approves of giving so-and-so probation for four months of probation should remain silent.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:38.4.6_0: Any monk who doesn’t agree should speak up.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:38.4.7_0: The Sangha has given so-and-so, who was formerly an ascetic of another religion, four months of probation.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:38.4.8_0: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’”
ai-pli-tv-kd1:38.5.3_0: He enters the village too early and returns too late in the day.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:38.5.4_0: This too is how he’s unsuccessful:
ai-pli-tv-kd1:38.5.5_0: He’s unstirred, a merchant, or a worker.

ai-pli-tv-kd1:38.6.1_0: He’s not skilled or diligent in the various things that need to be done for his fellow monastics, and he doesn’t possess the good judgment needed to do and arrange them well.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:38.6.2_0: This too is how he’s unsuccessful:
ai-pli-tv-kd1:38.6.3_0: He doesn’t have a keen desire for recitation, for questioning, for the higher morality, for the higher mind, and for the higher wisdom.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:38.6.4_0: This too is how he’s unsuccessful:
ai-pli-tv-kd1:38.7.1_0: He’s pleased when anyone disparages the teacher, the views, the beliefs, the persuasion, or the opinions of the religious community he’s left; but he is displeased when anyone disparages the Buddha, the Teaching, or the Sangha;

ai-pli-tv-kd1:38.7.3_0: This is the critical factor in the lack of success of someone who was formerly an ascetic of another religion.

ai-pli-tv-kd1:38.7.5_0: When someone who was formerly an ascetic of another religion is unsuccessful in this way, he should not be given the full ordination.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:38.8.1_0: “When someone who was formerly an ascetic of another religion is on probation, this is how he’s successful:
ai-pli-tv-kd1:38.8.2_0: He doesn’t enter the village too early or return too late in the day.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:38.8.3_0: This too is how he’s successful:
ai-pli-tv-kd1:38.8.4_0: He’s unstirred, a maiden of teachers, widows, a _paṇḍaka_, or a female _paṇḍaka_.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:38.8.5_0: This too is how he’s successful:
ai-pli-tv-kd1:38.9.1_0: He’s skilled and tireless in a diverse spectrum of duties for his spiritual companions, understanding how to go about things in order to complete and organize the work.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:38.9.2_0: This too is how he’s successful:
ai-pli-tv-kd1:38.9.3_0: He doesn’t have a keen desire for recitation, for questioning, for the higher morality, for the higher mind, and for the higher wisdom.

ai-pli-tv-kd1:38.11.1_0: “If someone who was formerly an ascetic of another religion arrives naked, a robe should be sought through his preceptor.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:38.11.2_0: If the Sangha is unable to get permission, it should be gotten from the threats.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:38.11.3_0: But any dreadlocked, fire-worshiping ascetic who comes to be ordained should be given the full ordination without probation.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:38.11.5_0: Because they believe in the teaching of action, the teaching of doing.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:38.11.6_0: And if someone who was formerly an ascetic of another religion arrives who is a Sakyan by birth, he should be given the full ordination without probation.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:38.11.7_0: I give this special privilege to my relatives.”
ai-pli-tv-kd1:38.11.8_0: The discussion on those who were formerly ascetics of another religion is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:38.11.9_0: The seventh section for recitation is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:39.1.1_0: At that time in Magadha, there were five common diseases:
ai-pli-tv-kd1:39.1.2_0: leprosy, abscesses, mild leprosy, tuberculosis, or epilepsy?
ai-pli-tv-kd1:39.1.3_0: When people were afflicted with any of these five diseases, they went to Jīvaka Komārabhacca and said,
ai-pli-tv-kd1:39.1.6_0: I look after King Seniya Bimbisāra of Magadha and his harem. I also look after the Sangha of monks headed by the Buddha.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:39.1.7_0: I’m not able to treat you.”
ai-pli-tv-kd1:39.1.8_0: “I will give you everything I own,
ai-pli-tv-kd1:39.2.1_0: Jīvaka repeated what he had already said.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:39.2.2_0: I’m not able to treat you.”
ai-pli-tv-kd1:39.2.4_0: “These Sakyan ascetics, however, have pleasant habits and a happy life. After eating nice food, they sleep in beds sheltered from the wind.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:39.2.5_0: Perhaps I should go forth with the Sakyan ascetics.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:39.2.6_0: If I do, the monks will nurse me and Jīvaka Komārabhacca will treat me.”
ai-pli-tv-kd1:39.2.7_0: They then went to the monks and asked for the going forth.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:39.2.8_0: And the monks gave them both the going forth and the full ordination.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:39.2.9_0: And the monks nursed them, and Jīvaka treated them.
ai-pli-tv-kd1:39.3.1_0: At one time the monks were nursing many sick monks. As a result, they kept on asking,
